title: [Large-Scale] Learning Object-Based Set Covering Mathematics Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (sets, functions, equations)
context.additional_context: A mathematics education course that integrates real-time interaction and project-based assessment in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners derive connections between mathematical concepts using set-covering models by analyzing learning object attributes

Learners can select the top three similar resources from a given learning resource dataset (10 items) using cosine similarity and Jaccard similarity techniques and explain how to apply the selected resources in actual learning scenarios within 500 characters.

Under given constraints (budget: 1 million KRW, time: 10 hours, resources: 3 types), learners can submit an optimal learning object combination design plan for a math problem-solving project (e.g., logistics route optimization) within one week by applying three optimization techniques (linear programming, genetic algorithms, dynamic programming), and achieve 4 or higher (out of 5) on the evaluation rubric (problem definition clarity, technique applicability, constraint fulfillment, creativity).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
